snippet.textDisplay: It took me two hours to figure out I wasn't gonna unlock anymore of the map. The combat and graphics are what excel in the game, haven't beaten it yet and would require multiple playthrus to verify how dynamic and intriguing the storyline is but so far it's meh. Fabien is alright in small doses but the dialogue overall is a bit lackluster. There's nothing so far that has shocked or surprised me n as for the underbelly of the world it's extremely tame and child safe.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm a big fan of Vampire: the Masquerade and narrative-driven games. So far, Iâ€™m enjoying this one â€” that said, itâ€™s not really a role-playing game and therefore not truly Bloodlines 2. The side quests are nothing more than mediocre fetch quests, and the main quest mostly feels like running from one dialogue scene to another. On top of that, character progression is very limited, with almost no meaningful role-playing elements. I do like the game (after about five hours of play), but I donâ€™t think itâ€™s a good game, and it definitely doesnâ€™t live up to the name of a VtM: Bloodlines sequel.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm a big fan of Vampire: the Masquerade and narrative-driven games. So far, Iâ€™m enjoying this one â€” that said, itâ€™s not really a role-playing game and therefore not truly Bloodlines 2. The side quests are nothing more than mediocre fetch quests, and the main quest mostly feels like running from one dialogue scene to another. On top of that, character progression is very limited, with almost no meaningful role-playing elements. I do like the game (after about five hours of play), but I donâ€™t think itâ€™s a good game, and it definitely doesnâ€™t live up to the name of a VtM: Bloodlines sequel.

snippet.textDisplay:
There is one important thing to know about clans: there will only be one passive skill, which will be assigned to the clan you choose at the beginning. Everything else can be unlocked. So choose what you think will make your battles easier, because there are more fights than dialogues here.
I chose Toreador for role-playing, and my god, how wrong I was. The passive skill that speeds you up is useless on high difficulty.
snippet.textOriginal:
There is one important thing to know about clans: there will only be one passive skill, which will be assigned to the clan you choose at the beginning. Everything else can be unlocked. So choose what you think will make your battles easier, because there are more fights than dialogues here.
I chose Toreador for role-playing, and my god, how wrong I was. The passive skill that speeds you up is useless on high difficulty.

snippet.textDisplay: If you're wanting to go on the hunt for the sigils, WAIT until you're supposed to go back to the haven to rest...when you have zero more side quests for the day! You'll save a ton of time, trust me. If you decide to revert to a previous autosave, you lose ALL progress toward your collected items, dagger/crosses, and sigils since the autosave.
snippet.textOriginal: If you're wanting to go on the hunt for the sigils, WAIT until you're supposed to go back to the haven to rest...when you have zero more side quests for the day! You'll save a ton of time, trust me. If you decide to revert to a previous autosave, you lose ALL progress toward your collected items, dagger/crosses, and sigils since the autosave.

snippet.textDisplay: this game is trash. what a huge disappointment of a sequel of a great first game. No weapons, no character sheet, no computers  no lockpicking, no real choices in dialog,  if you think of what this game could have been, and what we got,  man you should be pissed ..... this could of been a master peice because it looks great.   but man, its sure fun to play a role playing game, or building a character.  gee if we could of just got a real sequal to the first game.... think of the fun, glad i could get a refund on steam
snippet.textOriginal: this game is trash. what a huge disappointment of a sequel of a great first game. No weapons, no character sheet, no computers  no lockpicking, no real choices in dialog,  if you think of what this game could have been, and what we got,  man you should be pissed ..... this could of been a master peice because it looks great.   but man, its sure fun to play a role playing game, or building a character.  gee if we could of just got a real sequal to the first game.... think of the fun, glad i could get a refund on steam

snippet.textDisplay: Doing things that get you captured is by 'filling your masquerade bar' but a masquerade is about pretending you're something you're not... That is like saying 'you get arrested if you fill your law abiding bar'. If you don't know what I mean, it's freaken backwards. You should be draining the masquerade bar, not filling it. Because you are breaking the masquerade instead of obeying it.
snippet.textOriginal: Doing things that get you captured is by 'filling your masquerade bar' but a masquerade is about pretending you're something you're not... That is like saying 'you get arrested if you fill your law abiding bar'. If you don't know what I mean, it's freaken backwards. You should be draining the masquerade bar, not filling it. Because you are breaking the masquerade instead of obeying it.

snippet.textDisplay: Only thing I wish I knew sooner is this is a shadow of the great game they took the name from.  Stealth is awful,  no weapons,  or feeling of making your vampire in that universe.  If you liked the first game and the books,  this is going to be a HUGE let down.  Also no FoV slider or shake toggle.  Real feels like a worse version of the first in every way other than graphics.
snippet.textOriginal: Only thing I wish I knew sooner is this is a shadow of the great game they took the name from.  Stealth is awful,  no weapons,  or feeling of making your vampire in that universe.  If you liked the first game and the books,  this is going to be a HUGE let down.  Also no FoV slider or shake toggle.  Real feels like a worse version of the first in every way other than graphics.
